definitions.text: the particular portion of space occupied by something
examples: he put the lamp back in its place

definitions.text: a point occupied by troops for tactical reasons
a way of regarding situations or topics etc.
examples: consider what follows from the positivist view

definitions.text: the arrangement of the body and its limbs
examples: he assumed an attitude of surrender

definitions.text: the relative position or standing of things or especially persons in a society
examples: he had the status of a minor
the novel attained the status of a classic
atheists do not enjoy a favorable position in American life
he occupied a post in the treasury

definitions.text: the spatial property of a place where or way in which something is situated
examples: the position of the hands on the clock
he specified the spatial relations of every piece of furniture on the stage
the cars were in position

definitions.text: (in team sports) the role assigned to an individual player
examples: what position does he play?

definitions.text: the act of putting something in a certain place
a condition or position in which you find yourself
examples: the unpleasant situation (or position) of having to choose between two evils
found herself in a very fortunate situation

definitions.text: an opinion that is held in opposition to another in an argument or dispute
examples: there are two sides to every question

definitions.text: an item on a list or in a sequence
examples: in the second place
moved from third to fifth position

definitions.text: the post or function properly or customarily occupied or served by another
examples: can you go in my stead?
took his place
in lieu of

definitions.text: the act of positing; an assumption taken as a postulate or axiom
cause to be in an appropriate place, state, or relation
put into a certain place or abstract location
examples: Put your things here
Set the tray down
Set the dogs on the scent of the missing children
Place emphasis on a certain point
